name: Sonesta Bayfront Hotel Coconut Grove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful time at this hotel. We had family and friends who had been disapointed in Miami before by second rate hotels that were billed as classy and expensive online. So on our first trip to Miami we didn't know what to expect. What we found in the Sonesta was a very nice, low-key and friendly place. We had reserved a Bay-View King room, but when we arrived at our room the door locking mechanism wouldn't lock. With a single phone call to the front desk a maintenance person responded immediately. When he found he couldn't fix the problem quickly, the hotel moved us to a wonderful suite that looked over the bay. The rooms were simple, elegant and comfortable. The staff was always friendly and more than willing to help with any requests. I personally enjoyed sangria night at the poolside bar- very nice! The hotel was close to everything, specifically a Starbucks just a half a block down- I have to have my coffee in the morning. The valet parking was totally worth the extra money- it was secure and much less stressful than trying to find a parking space. For the rate that we paid (under $100 on an internet site) I was more than impressed. Also, the concierge Chaz was super friendly- he gave a lot of good info. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay there again if back in Miami.
reviews.title: A Nice Surprise!

likes.disliked: — Trust guest reviews over flashy website photos!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From my experience, most hotels would usually give you a better deal if you call them direct which we did and got the parking package for one night at $169 (with taxes, etc. it ended up costing $189). This was supposed to include free valet parking and free breakfast according to the man I talked to when we booked. We stayed Sat. night, Sept. 23, which looks like it's the same weekend that the previous lady stayed for $110.
reviews.title: Sounds like it's better to book an internet deal than direct

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, and very well done as a renovated older hotel. It has a new sleak, modern decor and our room had a king bed as promised with white linens which I wish all hotels would use. I also liked the coffee maker in the room and the paper at the door in the morning.
reviews.title: You cant beat this Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't feel like we were told the "whole truth" when we were told we'd have free breakfast with our room package. As it ended up, it was a free continental breakfast. We weren't real upset by this news so went to breakfast the next morning to find out that the hotel only gives you ONE free continental breakfast. I felt embarrassed and wanted to leave but the gracious lady managing their restaurant insisted we stay and she told us to help ourselves. (the fresh fruit and pastries, juice and coffee were all wonderful and the restaurant is overlooking the water with an outdoor patio that was perfect for a lazy morning).
reviews.title: Loved the Sonnesta and Scotty's

reviews.text: However, when we asked again at the desk as we check out, whether the breakfast for one was a mistake, we were told,"No." Very, very strange. So if you're offered a "free breakfast" with a package, ask if it's full or continental and if only one person in your party of two using the room gets to eat.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Sonesta

likes.disliked: — A/C thermostat did not work. The room was a little too cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Although located in a high class neighbourhood, the hotel itself is situated at a rather non-descript junction of 2 angled streets. And you have to walk on McFarlane Rd - a junky street - to reach Cocowalk, which is essentially a huge tourist trap.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

description: Tucked away in the verdant enclave of Coconut Grove, Sonesta Bayfront Hotel reflects all the originality and spice of this trendy, artistic neighborhood on the coast of Biscayne and adjacent to Coral Gables.
